values: To dig is to make a hole in the ground.
My dog digs in the yard so he can hide his bones.
n. 戳，刺；挖苦DIGabbr. Deputy Inspector-General 副监察长

- vi. 挖掘

DIGabbr. Deputy Inspector-General 副监察长

时 态:  
dug 
digging, digs
vt.（如用铲、锨或推土机等）挖掘,探究，发掘,刺，戳,喜欢，欣赏vi.挖掘，松土,整理,〈俚〉已理解n.一拳，一推,挖苦，讽刺,考古发掘
vt.（如用铲、锨或推土机等）挖掘,探究，发掘,刺，戳,喜欢，欣赏vi.挖掘，松土,整理,〈俚〉已理解n.一拳，一推,挖苦，讽刺,考古发掘
挖, 挖掘, 掘, 掏 (verb.)
To dig is to break up and move soil, dirt, or other material with a tool, such as a shovel or pickaxe.
To dig is to break up and move earth, sand, or other material using a tool, or to search or investigate in a determined way.
n. 戳，刺；挖苦,vi. 挖掘,vt. 挖，掘；探究
